title: Long-lasting Sadness After Loss
friendly_definition: Prolonged Grief is when you feel extremely sad for a long time after someone you love dies. It can make you feel like you can't move on and imagine life without them.
real_life_example: When a teen loses their best friend in a car accident and can't stop crying every day, feeling like life will never be the same without them.
often_confused_with: People might mistake Prolonged Grief for regular sadness or depression, not realizing it's a specific condition that lasts longer and is harder to overcome.
research_insight: Some people who experience intense grief after losing a loved one may develop Prolonged Grief Disorder, which is a mental health condition that needs special attention and care.
personal_check_in: Have you ever felt like you can't stop missing someone who's no longer here? How has that affected your daily life and ability to imagine a future without them?
